You can drizzle this honey over pepperoni pizza (trust!), serve alongside spicy fried chicken, use in a glaze for grilled pork or fish, and/or add a few spoonfuls to savory cornbread.IngredientsMakes about 2 cups12garlic cloves (about 1 head), crushed1½cups raw honeySpecial EquipmentA heatproof 1-qt. jarPreparationStep 1Place garlic in jar. Pour honey over garlic and stir to combine, making sure all the garlic gets coated. Seal jar and let sit at room temperature 3 days. Unscrew and remove lid to let out any gases; give garlic honey a stir. (You’ll most likely see tiny bubbles at this stage, which means the fermentation process has started.) Reseal jar and let sit, stirring once every other day, at least 1 week before using.Step 2Do Ahead: Garlic honey can be made 1 month ahead.
